page.title: 09LUDFORD GRANGE
page.content: 85 year old Mr.G.H.Brant has farmed the Grange for 60 years _ forebears from Holland in 18thC to introduce Dutch drainage methods to fenlands of Lincs. which became New Holland. They were shipwrecked and stayed to settle. When he started he had 13 horses with 3 men to look after them, 3 labourers, a foreman and a Garthman. In those days the village had its own Saddler, Blacksmith, Wheelwright, Coal Merchant Carpenter/Undertaker &c. All now gone and these services found elsewhere.The Horse Age has ended in his lifetime. A man & 2 horses could plough an acre a day. Today a tractor can plough 20 acres a day _ more with headlamps at night. In the old days a furrow was 9 inches wide & 6 inches deep. Today a plough can cut many furrows up to 2 ft deep.60 years ago land cost under Â£30 per acre _ today it is around Â£2000.
